title: Jojo Rabbit
summary: A young German boy in the Hitler Youth whose hero and imaginary friend is the country's dictator is shocked to discover that his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home.
producer: Carthew Neal, Taika Waititi, and Chelsea Winstanley

title: Marriage Story
summary: Noah Baumbach's incisive and compassionate look at a marriage breaking up and a family staying together.

title: The Irishman
summary: Hitman Frank Sheeran looks back at the secrets he kept as a loyal member of the Bufalino crime family.
producer: Martin Scorsese, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, and Emma Tillinger Koskoff

title: Parasite
summary: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

title: Little Women
summary: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.

title: Ford v Ferrari
summary: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference and the laws of physics to build a revolutionary race car for Ford in order to defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.
producer: Peter Chernin, Jenno Topping, and James Mangold

title: Once Upon a Time... In Hollywood
summary: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.
film: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
producer: David Heyman, Shannon McIntosh, and Quentin Tarantino

summary: April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.
producer: Sam Mendes, Pippa Harris, Jayne-Ann Tenggren, and Callum McDougall

title: Joker
summary: A mentally troubled stand-up comedian embarks on a downward spiral that leads to the creation of an iconic villain.
producer: Todd Phillips, Bradley Cooper, and Emma Tillinger Koskoff

title: Roma
summary: A year in the life of a middle-class family's maid in Mexico City in the early 1970s.

title: The Favourite
summary: In early 18th-century England, the status quo at the court is upset when a new servant arrives and endears herself to a frail Queen Anne.
producer: Ceci Dempsey, Ed Guiney, Lee Magiday, and Yorgos Lanthimos

title: Vice
summary: The story of Dick Cheney, an unassuming bureaucratic Washington insider, who quietly wielded immense power as Vice President to George W. Bush, reshaping the country and the globe in ways that are still felt today.
producer: Dede Gardner, Jeremy Kleiner, Adam McKay, and Kevin Messick

title: BlacKkKlansman
summary: Ron Stallworth, an African American police officer from Colorado Springs, CO, successfully manages to infiltrate the local Ku Klux Klan branch with the help of a Jewish surrogate who eventually becomes its leader. Based on actual events.
producer: Sean McKittrick, Jason Blum, Raymond Mansfield, Jordan Peele, and Spike Lee

title: Green Book
summary: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.
producer: Jim Burke, Charles B. Wessler, Brian Currie, Peter Farrelly, and Nick Vallelonga

title: A Star Is Born
summary: A musician helps a young singer find fame as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral.
producer: Bill Gerber, Bradley Cooper, and Lynette Howell Taylor

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
summary: The story of the legendary British rock band Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury, leading up to their famous performance at Live Aid (1985).

title: Black Panther
summary: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

title: Call Me by Your Name
summary: In 1980s Italy, romance blossoms between a seventeen-year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.
producer: Peter Spears, Luca Guadagnino, Emilie Georges, and Marco Morabito

title: Phantom Thread
summary: Set in 1950s London, Reynolds Woodcock is a renowned dressmaker whose fastidious life is disrupted by a young, strong-willed woman, Alma, who becomes his muse and lover.
producer: JoAnne Sellar, Paul Thomas Anderson, Megan Ellison, and Daniel Lupi

title: Lady Bird
summary: In 2002, an artistically inclined seventeen-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.
producer: Scott Rudin, Eli Bush, and Evelyn O'Neill

title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
summary: A mother personally challenges the local authorities to solve her daughter's murder when they fail to catch the culprit.
producer: Graham Broadbent, Pete Czernin, and Martin McDonagh

title: Darkest Hour
summary: In May 1940, the fate of World War II hangs on Winston Churchill, who must decide whether to negotiate with Adolf Hitler, or fight on knowing that it could mean the end of the British Empire.
producer: Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Lisa Bruce, Anthony McCarten, and Douglas Urbanski

title: The Shape of Water
summary: At a top secret research facility in the 1960s, a lonely janitor forms a unique relationship with an amphibious creature that is being held in captivity.
producer: Guillermo del Toro and J. Miles Dale

title: The Post
summary: A cover-up spanning four U.S. Presidents pushes the country's first female newspaper publisher and her editor to join an unprecedented battle between press and government.
producer: Amy Pascal, Steven Spielberg, and Kristie Macosko Krieger

title: Get Out
summary: A young African-American visits his white girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.
producer: Sean McKittrick, Jason Blum, Edward H. Hamm Jr., and Jordan Peele

title: Dunkirk
summary: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

title: Hell or High Water
summary: A divorced father and his ex-con older brother resort to a desperate scheme in order to save their family's ranch in West Texas.

title: Moonlight
summary: A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood.
producer: Adele Romanski, Dede Gardner, and Jeremy Kleiner

title: Manchester by the Sea
summary: A depressed uncle is asked to take care of his teenage nephew after the boy's father dies.
producer: Matt Damon, Kimberly Steward, Chris Moore, Lauren Beck, and Kevin J. Walsh

title: Lion
summary: A five-year-old Indian boy is adopted by an Australian couple after getting lost hundreds of kilometers from home. 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.
producer: Emile Sherman, Iain Canning, and Angie Fielder

title: Fences
summary: A working-class African-American father tries to raise his family in the 1950s, while coming to terms with the events of his life.
producer: Scott Rudin, Denzel Washington, and Todd Black

title: Hacksaw Ridge
summary: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

title: Arrival
summary: A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.
producer: Shawn Levy, Dan Levine, Aaron Ryder, and David Linde

title: La La Land
summary: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.
producer: Fred Berger, Jordan Horowitz, and Marc Platt

title: Hidden Figures
summary: The story of a team of female African-American mathematicians who served a vital role in NASA during the early years of the U.S. space program.
producer: Donna Gigliotti, Peter Chernin, Jenno Topping, Pharrell Williams, and Theodore Melfi

title: Room
summary: Held captive for 7 years in an enclosed space, a woman and her young son finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.

title: Brooklyn
summary: An Irish immigrant lands in 1950s Brooklyn, where she quickly falls into a romance with a local. When her past catches up with her, however, she must choose between two countries and the lives that exist within.

title: Spotlight
summary: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.
producer: Blye Pagon Faust, Steve Golin, Nicole Rocklin, and Michael Sugar

title: The Big Short
summary: In 2006-2007 a group of investors bet against the US mortgage market. In their research, they discover how flawed and corrupt the market is.
producer: Dede Gardner, Jeremy Kleiner, and Brad Pitt

title: Bridge of Spies
summary: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.
producer: Steven Spielberg, Marc Platt, and Kristie Macosko Krieger

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
summary: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.

title: The Revenant
summary: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.
producer: Arnon Milchan, Steve Golin, Alejandro G. Iñárritu, Mary Parent, and Keith Redmon

title: The Martian
summary: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive and can survive until a potential rescue.
producer: Simon Kinberg, Ridley Scott, Michael Schaefer, and Mark Huffam

title: Whiplash
summary: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.
producer: Jason Blum, Helen Estabrook, and David Lancaster

title: Boyhood
summary: The life of Mason, from early childhood to his arrival at college.

title: The Theory of Everything
summary: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.
producer: Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Lisa Bruce, and Anthony McCarten

title: Birdman or
summary: A washed-up superhero actor attempts to revive his fading career by writing, directing, and starring in a Broadway production.
film: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
producer: Alejandro G. Iñárritu, John Lesher, and James W. Skotchdopole

title: Selma
summary: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.
producer: Christian Colson, Oprah Winfrey, Dede Gardner, and Jeremy Kleiner

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
summary: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.
producer: Wes Anderson, Scott Rudin, Steven M. Rales, and Jeremy Dawson

title: The Imitation Game
summary: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.
producer: Nora Grossman, Ido Ostrowsky, and Teddy Schwarzman

title: American Sniper
summary: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home with his family after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.
producer: Clint Eastwood, Andrew Lazar, Robert Lorenz, Bradley Cooper, and Peter Morgan

title: Nebraska
summary: An aging, booze-addled father makes the trip from Montana to Nebraska with his estranged son in order to claim a million-dollar Mega Sweepstakes Marketing prize.

title: Her
summary: In a near future, a lonely writer develops an unlikely relationship with an operating system designed to meet his every need.
producer: Megan Ellison, Spike Jonze, and Vincent Landay

title: Dallas Buyers Club
summary: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

title: Philomena
summary: A world-weary political journalist picks up the story of a woman's search for her son, who was taken away from her decades ago after she became pregnant and was forced to live in a convent.
producer: Gabrielle Tana, Steve Coogan, and Tracey Seaward

title: 12 Years a Slave
summary: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.
producer: Brad Pitt, Dede Gardner, Jeremy Kleiner, Steve McQueen, and Anthony Katagas

title: Captain Phillips
summary: The true story of Captain Richard Phillips and the 2009 hijacking by Somali pirates of the U.S.-flagged MV Maersk Alabama, the first American cargo ship to be hijacked in two hundred years.
producer: Scott Rudin, Dana Brunetti, and Michael De Luca

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
summary: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.
producer: Martin Scorsese, Leonardo DiCaprio, Joey McFarland, and Emma Tillinger Koskoff

title: American Hustle
summary: A con man, Irving Rosenfeld, along with his seductive partner Sydney Prosser, is forced to work for a wild F.B.I. Agent, Richie DiMaso, who pushes them into a world of Jersey powerbrokers and the Mafia.
producer: Charles Roven, Richard Suckle, Megan Ellison, and Jonathan Gordon

title: Gravity
summary: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

title: Amour
summary: Georges and Anne are an octogenarian couple. They are cultivated, retired music teachers. Their daughter, also a musician, lives in Britain with her family. One day, Anne has a stroke, and the couple's bond of love is severely tested.
producer: Margaret Menegoz, Stefan Arndt, Veit Heiduschka, and Michael Katz

title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
summary: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.
producer: Dan Janvey, Josh Penn, and Michael Gottwald

title: Zero Dark Thirty
summary: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.
producer: Mark Boal, Kathryn Bigelow, and Megan Ellison

title: Life of Pi
summary: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.
producer: Gil Netter, Ang Lee, and David Womark

title: Silver Linings Playbook
summary: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.
producer: Donna Gigliotti, Bruce Cohen, and Jonathan Gordon

title: Argo
summary: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.
producer: Grant Heslov, Ben Affleck, and George Clooney

title: Les Misérables
summary: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.
producer: Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, Debra Hayward, and Cameron Mackintosh

title: Django Unchained
summary: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation-owner in Mississippi.
producer: Stacey Sher, Reginald Hudlin, and Pilar Savone

title: Lincoln
summary: As the American Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

title: The Tree of Life
summary: The story of a family in Waco, Texas in The eldest son witnesses the loss of innocence and struggles with his parents' conflicting teachings.
producer: Sarah Green, Bill Pohlad, Dede Gardner, and Grant Hill

title: Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close
summary: A nine-year-old amateur inventor, Francophile, and pacifist searches New York City for the lock that matches a mysterious key left behind by his father, who died in the World Trade Center on September 11, 2001.

title: The Artist
summary: An egomaniacal film star develops a relationship with a young dancer against the backdrop of Hollywood's silent era.

title: Midnight in Paris
summary: While on a trip to Paris with his fiancée's family, a nostalgic screenwriter finds himself mysteriously going back to the 1920s every day at midnight.

title: Hugo
summary: In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.

title: Moneyball
summary: Oakland A's general manager Billy Beane's successful attempt to assemble a baseball team on a lean budget by employing computer-generated analysis to acquire new players.
producer: Michael De Luca, Rachael Horovitz, and Brad Pitt

title: War Horse
summary: Young Albert enlists to serve in World War I after his beloved horse is sold to the cavalry. Albert's hopeful journey takes him out of England and to the front lines as the war rages on.

title: The Descendants
summary: A land baron tries to reconnect with his two daughters after his wife is seriously injured in a boating accident.
producer: Jim Burke, Alexander Payne, and Jim Taylor

title: The Help
summary: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.
producer: Brunson Green, Chris Columbus, and Michael Barnathan

title: Winter's Bone
summary: An unflinching Ozark Mountain girl hacks through dangerous social terrain as she hunts down her drug-dealing father while trying to keep her family intact.

title: 127 Hours
summary: A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.

title: The Kids Are All Right
summary: Two children conceived by artificial insemination bring their biological father into their non-traditional family life.

title: The Fighter
summary: Based on the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.

title: The Social Network
summary: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea, and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.
producer: Dana Brunetti, Ceán Chaffin, Michael De Luca, and Scott Rudin

title: Black Swan
summary: A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake".
producer: Scott Franklin, Mike Medavoy, and Brian Oliver

title: The King's Speech
summary: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.
producer: Iain Canning, Emile Sherman, and Gareth Unwin

title: True Grit
summary: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.
producer: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen, and Scott Rudin

title: Inception
summary: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

title: Toy Story 3
summary: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

title: A Serious Man
summary: Larry Gopnik, a Midwestern physics teacher, watches his life unravel over multiple sudden incidents. Though seeking meaning and answers amidst his turmoils, he seems to keep sinking.

title: An Education
summary: A coming-of-age story about a teenage girl in 1960s suburban London, and how her life changes with the arrival of a playboy nearly twice her age.

title: The Hurt Locker
summary: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

title: Precious
summary: In New York City's Harlem circa 1987, an overweight, abused, illiterate teen who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that she can re-route her life in a better direction.
film: Precious: Based on the Novel 'Push' by Sapphire
producer: Lee Daniels, Sarah Siegel-Magness, and Gary Magness

title: Up in the Air
summary: Ryan Bingham enjoys living out of a suitcase for his job, travelling around the country firing people, but finds that lifestyle threatened by the presence of a potential love interest, and a new hire presenting a new business model.

title: District 9
summary: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

title: Inglourious Basterds
summary: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

title: The Blind Side
summary: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All-American football player and first-round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

title: Up
summary: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

title: Avatar
summary: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

title: Frost/Nixon
summary: A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.
producer: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, and Eric Fellner

title: Milk
summary: The story of Harvey Milk and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

title: The Reader
summary: Post-WWII Germany: Nearly a decade after his affair with an older woman came to a mysterious end, law student Michael Berg re-encounters his former lover as she defends herself in a war-crime trial.
producer: Anthony Minghella, Sydney Pollack, Donna Gigliotti, and Redmond Morris

title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
summary: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with consequences.
film: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
producer: Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall, and Ceán Chaffin

title: Slumdog Millionaire
summary: A Mumbai teenager reflects on his life after being accused of cheating on the Indian version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?".

title: There Will Be Blood
summary: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.
producer: Paul Thomas Anderson, Daniel Lupi, and JoAnne Sellar

title: Michael Clayton
summary: A law firm brings in its "fixer" to remedy the situation after a lawyer has a breakdown while representing a chemical company that he knows is guilty in a multibillion-dollar class action suit.

title: Atonement
summary: Thirteen-year-old fledgling writer Briony Tallis irrevocably changes the course of several lives when she accuses her older sister's lover of a crime he did not commit.
producer: Tim Bevan, Eric Fellner, and Paul Webster

title: No Country for Old Men
summary: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.
producer: Scott Rudin, Joel Coen, and Ethan Coen

title: Juno
summary: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual decision regarding the unborn child.
producer: Lianne Halfon, Mason Novick, and Russell Smith

title: Letters from Iwo Jima
summary: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.

title: Babel
summary: Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families.
producer: Alejandro González Iñárritu, Steve Golin, and Jon Kilik

title: The Queen
summary: After the death of Princess Diana, Queen Elizabeth II struggles with her reaction to a sequence of events nobody could have predicted.
producer: Andy Harries, Christine Langan, and Tracey Seaward

title: Little Miss Sunshine
summary: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.
producer: David T. Friendly, Peter Saraf, and Marc Turtletaub

title: The Departed
summary: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

title: Capote
summary: In 1959, Truman Capote learns of the murder of a Kansas family and decides to write a book about the case. While researching for his novel In Cold Blood, Capote forms a relationship with one of the killers, Perry Smith, who is on death row.

title: Good Night, and Good Luck.
summary: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy.

title: Munich
summary: After the Black September capture and massacre of Israeli athletes at the 1972 Olympics, five men are chosen to eliminate the people responsible for that fateful day.
producer: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, and Barry Mendel

title: Crash
summary: Los Angeles citizens with vastly separate lives collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption.

title: Brokeback Mountain
summary: Ennis and Jack are two shepherds who develop a sexual and emotional relationship. Their relationship becomes complicated when both of them get married to their respective girlfriends.

title: Finding Neverland
summary: The story of Sir J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.
producer: Richard N. Gladstein and Nellie Bellflower

title: Sideways
summary: Two men reaching middle age with not much to show but disappointment embark on a week-long road trip through California's wine country, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle.

title: Ray
summary: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.

title: Million Dollar Baby
summary: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.
producer: Clint Eastwood, Albert S. Ruddy, and Tom Rosenberg

title: The Aviator
summary: A biopic depicting the early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career from the late 1920s to the mid 1940s.

title: Lost in Translation
summary: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

title: Mystic River
summary: The lives of three men who were childhood friends are shattered when one of them has a family tragedy.
producer: Robert Lorenz, Judie G. Hoyt, and Clint Eastwood

title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
summary: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.
film: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
producer: Samuel Goldwyn Jr., Peter Weir, and Duncan Henderson

title: Seabiscuit
summary: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
summary: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.
film: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
producer: Barrie M. Osborne, Peter Jackson, and Fran Walsh

title: The Pianist
summary: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.
producer: Roman Polanski, Robert Benmussa, and Alain Sarde

title: The Hours
summary: The story of how the novel "Mrs. Dalloway" affects three generations of women, all of whom, in one way or another, have had to deal with suicide in their lives.

title: Gangs of New York
summary: In 1862, Amsterdam Vallon returns to the Five Points area of New York City seeking revenge against Bill the Butcher, his father's killer.

title: Chicago
summary: Two death-row murderesses develop a fierce rivalry while competing for publicity, celebrity, and a sleazy lawyer's attention.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
summary: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.
film: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
producer: Barrie M. Osborne, Fran Walsh, and Peter Jackson

title: In the Bedroom
summary: A New England couple's college-aged son dates an older woman who has two small children and an unwelcome ex-husband.

title: Gosford Park
summary: Set in the 1930s, this movie brings a group of pretentious rich and famous together for a weekend of relaxation at a hunting resort. But when a murder occurs, each one of these interesting characters becomes a suspect.
producer: Robert Altman, Bob Balaban, and David Levy

title: Moulin Rouge!
summary: A poor Bohemian poet in 1890s Paris falls for a beautiful courtesan and nightclub star coveted by a jealous duke.
producer: Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann, and Fred Baron

title: A Beautiful Mind
summary: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
summary: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.
film: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
producer: Peter Jackson, Fran Walsh, and Barrie M. Osborne

title: Chocolat
summary: A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.
producer: David Brown, Kit Golden, and Leslie Holleran

title: Traffic
summary: A conservative judge is appointed by the President to spearhead America's escalating war against drugs, only to discover that his teenage daughter is a crack addict. Two DEA agents protect an informant. A jailed drug baron's wife attempts to carry on the family business.
producer: Edward Zwick, Marshall Herskovitz, and Laura Bickford

title: Erin Brockovich
summary: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.
producer: Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, and Stacey Sher

title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
summary: A young Chinese warrior steals a sword from a famed swordsman and then escapes into a world of romantic adventure with a mysterious man in the frontier of the nation.
producer: William Kong, Hsu Li-kong, and Ang Lee

title: Gladiator
summary: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
producer: Douglas Wick, David Franzoni, and Branko Lustig

title: The Insider
summary: A research chemist comes under personal and professional attack when he decides to appear in a 60 Minutes exposé on Big Tobacco.
producer: Pieter Jan Brugge and Michael Mann

title: The Cider House Rules
summary: A compassionate young man, raised in an orphanage and trained to be a doctor there, decides to leave to see the world.

title: American Beauty
summary: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

title: The Green Mile
summary: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.

title: The Sixth Sense
summary: A frightened, withdrawn Philadelphia boy who communicates with spirits seeks the help of a disheartened child psychologist.
producer: Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, and Barry Mendel

title: Elizabeth
summary: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.
producer: Alison Owen, Eric Fellner and Tim Bevan

title: The Thin Red Line
summary: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.
producer: Robert Michael Geisler, John Roberdeau, and Grant Hill

title: Life Is Beautiful
summary: When an open-minded Jewish waiter and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

title: Shakespeare in Love
summary: The world's greatest ever playwright, William Shakespeare, is young, out of ideas and short of cash, but meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.
producer: David Parfitt, Donna Gigliotti, Harvey Weinstein, Edward Zwick, and Marc Norman

title: Saving Private Ryan
summary: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.
producer: Steven Spielberg, Ian Bryce, Mark Gordon, and Gary Levinsohn

title: The Full Monty
summary: Six unemployed steel workers form a male striptease act. The women cheer them on to go for "the full monty" - total nudity.

title: L.A. Confidential
summary: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.
producer: Curtis Hanson, Arnon Milchan, and Michael Nathanson

title: Good Will Hunting
summary: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

title: As Good as It Gets
summary: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.
producer: James L. Brooks, Bridget Johnson, and Kristi Zea

title: Titanic
summary: A seventeen-year-old aristocrat falls in love with a kind but poor artist aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R.M.S. Titanic.

title: Secrets & Lies
summary: Following the death of her adoptive parents, a successful young black optometrist establishes contact with her biological mother -- a lonely white factory worker living in poverty in East London.

title: Fargo
summary: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

title: Shine
summary: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular if not critical acclaim.

title: The English Patient
summary: At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.

title: Jerry Maguire
summary: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent agent with the only athlete who stays with him and his former colleague.
producer: James L. Brooks, Laurence Mark, Richard Sakai, and Cameron Crowe

title: The Postman
summary: A simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet, and then uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.
producer: Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, and Gaetano Daniele

title: Sense and Sensibility
summary: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

title: Babe
summary: Babe, a pig raised by sheepdogs on a rural English farm, learns to herd sheep with a little help from Farmer Hoggett.
producer: Bill Miller, George Miller, and Doug Mitchell

title: Braveheart
summary: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.
producer: Mel Gibson, Alan Ladd Jr., and Bruce Davey

title: Apollo 13
summary: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

title: Quiz Show
summary: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.
producer: Michael Jacobs, Julian Krainin, Michael Nozik, and Robert Redford

title: The Shawshank Redemption
summary: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
summary: Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love.

title: Pulp Fiction
summary: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

title: Forrest Gump
summary: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.
producer: Wendy Finerman, Steve Tisch, and Steve Starkey

title: The Remains of the Day
summary: A butler who sacrificed body and soul to service in the years leading up to World War II realizes too late how misguided his loyalty was to his lordly employer.
producer: Mike Nichols, John Calley, and Ismail Merchant

title: In the Name of the Father
summary: A man's coerced confession to an I.R.A. bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.
film: In the Name of the Father

title: The Piano
summary: In the mid-19th century a mute woman is sent to New Zealand along with her young daughter and prized piano for an arranged marriage to a farmer, but is soon lusted after by a farm worker.

title: Schindler's List
summary: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.
producer: Steven Spielberg, Gerald R. Molen, and Branko Lustig

title: The Fugitive
summary: Dr. Richard Kimble, unjustly accused of murdering his wife, must find the real killer while being the target of a nationwide manhunt led by a seasoned U.S. Marshal.

title: Howards End
summary: A businessman thwarts his wife's bequest of an estate to another woman.

title: The Crying Game
summary: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

title: Scent of a Woman
summary: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

title: Unforgiven
summary: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan and a young man, The "Schofield Kid."

title: A Few Good Men
summary: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.
producer: David Brown, Rob Reiner, and Andrew Scheinman

title: Bugsy
summary: The story of how Benjamin "Bugsy" Siegel started Las Vegas.
producer: Mark Johnson, Barry Levinson and Warren Beatty

title: JFK
summary: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.
producer: A. Kitman Ho and Oliver Stone

title: The Prince of Tides
summary: A troubled man talks to his suicidal sister's psychiatrist about their family history and falls in love with her in the process.
producer: Barbra Streisand and Andrew S. Karsch

title: The Silence of the Lambs
summary: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.
producer: Edward Saxon, Kenneth Utt, and Ron Bozman

title: Beauty and the Beast
summary: A prince cursed to spend his days as a hideous monster sets out to regain his humanity by earning a young woman's love.

title: Goodfellas
summary: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

title: Awakenings
summary: The victims of an encephalitis epidemic many years ago have been catatonic ever since, but now a new drug offers the prospect of reviving them.

title: The Godfather, Part III
summary: Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire.

title: Dances with Wolves
summary: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, befriends wolves and Native Americans, making him an intolerable aberration in the military.

title: Ghost
summary: After a young man is murdered, his spirit stays behind to warn his lover of impending danger, with the help of a reluctant psychic.

title: My Left Foot
summary: Christy Brown, born with cerebral palsy, learns to paint and write with his only controllable limb - his left foot.

title: Field of Dreams
summary: Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella is inspired by a voice he can't ignore to pursue a dream he can hardly believe. Supported by his wife, Ray begins the quest by turning his ordinary cornfield into a place where dreams can come true.

title: Born on the Fourth of July
summary: The biography of Ron Kovic. Paralyzed in the Vietnam war, he becomes an anti-war and pro-human rights political activist after feeling betrayed by the country for which he fought.
film: Born on the Fourth of July
producer: A. Kitman Ho and Oliver Stone

title: Dead Poets Society
summary: Maverick teacher John Keating uses poetry to embolden his boarding school students to new heights of self-expression.
producer: Steven Haft, Paul Junger Witt, and Tony Thomas

title: Driving Miss Daisy
summary: An old Jewish woman and her African-American chauffeur in the American South have a relationship that grows and improves over the years.
producer: Richard D. Zanuck and Lili Fini Zanuck

title: The Accidental Tourist
summary: An emotionally distant writer of travel guides must carry on with his life after his son is killed and his marriage crumbles.
producer: Lawrence Kasdan, Charles Okun, and Michael Grillo

title: Mississippi Burning
summary: Two F.B.I. Agents with wildly different styles arrive in Mississippi to investigate the disappearance of some civil rights activists.
producer: Frederick Zollo and Robert F. Colesberry

title: Dangerous Liaisons
summary: A scheming widow and her manipulative ex-lover make a bet regarding the corruption of a recently married woman.

title: Working Girl
summary: When a secretary's idea is stolen by her boss, she seizes an opportunity to steal it back by pretending she has her boss' job.

title: Rain Man
summary: After a selfish L.A. yuppie learns his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic-savant brother in Ohio that he didn't know existed, he absconds with his brother and sets out across the country, hoping to gain a larger inheritance.

title: Hope and Glory
summary: Bill, a young boy living on the outskirts of London experiences the exhilaration of World War II. During this period, Bill learns about sex, death, love, hypocrisy, and the faults of adults as he prowls the ruins of bombed houses.

title: The Last Emperor
summary: The story of the final Emperor of China.

title: Broadcast News
summary: Take two rival television reporters: one handsome, one talented, both male. Add one producer, female. Mix well, and watch the sparks fly.

title: Moonstruck
summary: Loretta Castorini, a bookkeeper from Brooklyn, New York, finds herself in a difficult situation when she falls for the brother of the man she has agreed to marry.
producer: Patrick J. Palmer and Norman Jewison

title: Fatal Attraction
summary: A married man's one-night stand comes back to haunt him when that lover begins to stalk him and his family.
producer: Stanley R. Jaffe and Sherry Lansing

title: The Mission
summary: Eighteenth-century Spanish Jesuits try to protect a remote South American tribe in danger of falling under the rule of pro-slavery Portugal.

title: A Room with a View
summary: Lucy meets George in a Florence pensione and the two share a brief romance before Lucy returns home, where she becomes engaged to Cecil. However, it isn't long before George unexpectedly enters her life again.

title: Children of a Lesser God
summary: A new speech teacher at a school for the deaf falls in love with the janitor, a deaf woman speechless by choice.
producer: Burt Sugarman and Patrick J. Palmer

title: Hannah and Her Sisters
summary: Between two Thanksgivings two years apart, Hannah's husband falls in love with her sister Lee, while her hypochondriac ex-husband rekindles his relationship with her sister Holly.

title: Platoon
summary: Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam, finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil. A shrewd examination of the brutality of war and the duality of man in conflict.

title: Kiss of the Spider Woman
summary: A gay man and a political prisoner are together in a prison. The gay man narrates the stories of two fake movies and his own life.

title: Prizzi's Honor
summary: Two professional assassins fall in love.

title: Witness
summary: When a young Amish boy is sole witness to a murder while visiting Philadelphia with his mother, police detective John Book tries to protect the boy until an attempt on Book's life forces him into hiding in Amish country.

title: Out of Africa
summary: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness/plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

title: The Color Purple
summary: A black Southern woman struggles to find her identity after suffering abuse from her father and others over four decades.
producer: Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall, and Quincy Jones

title: A Soldier's Story
summary: An African-American officer investigates a murder in a racially charged situation in World War II.
producer: Norman Jewison, Ronald L. Schwary, and Patrick Palmer

title: A Passage to India
summary: Cultural mistrust and false accusations doom a friendship in British colonial India between an Indian doctor, an Englishwoman engaged to marry a city magistrate, and an English educator.
producer: John Brabourne and Richard B. Goodwin

title: The Killing Fields
summary: A journalist is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's bloody 'Year Zero' cleansing campaign, which claimed the lives of two million 'undesirable' civilians.

title: Places in the Heart
summary: In central Texas in the 1930s, a widow with two small children tries to save her small 40-acre farm with the help of a blind boarder and an itinerant black handyman.

title: Amadeus
summary: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

title: The Dresser
summary: Personal assistant Norman struggles to get deteriorating veteran actor Sir through a difficult performance of King Lear.

title: Tender Mercies
summary: A broken-down, middle-aged country singer gets a new wife, reaches out to his long-lost daughter, and tries to put his troubled life back together.

title: The Right Stuff
summary: The U.S. space program's development from the breaking of the sound barrier to selection of the Mercury 7 astronauts, from a group of test pilots with a more seat-of-the-pants approach than the program's more cautious engineers preferred.

title: The Big Chill
summary: A group of seven former college friends gather for a weekend reunion at a South Carolina vacation home after the funeral of another of their college friends.

title: Terms of Endearment
summary: Follows hard-to-please Aurora looking for love, and her daughter's family problems.

title: Missing
summary: When an idealistic American writer disappears during the Chilean coup d'état in September 1973, his wife and father try to find him.

title: Gandhi
summary: The life of the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.

title: The Verdict
summary: An outcast, alcoholic Boston lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.
producer: Richard D. Zanuck and David Brown

title: Tootsie
summary: Michael Dorsey, an unsuccessful actor, disguises himself as a woman in order to get a role on a trashy hospital soap.

title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
summary: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape from Earth and return to his home planet.

title: Atlantic City
summary: In a corrupt city, a small-time gangster and the estranged wife of a pot dealer find themselves thrown together in an escapade of love, money, drugs and danger.

title: Reds
summary: A radical American journalist becomes involved with the Communist revolution in Russia, and hopes to bring its spirit and idealism to the United States.

title: Chariots of Fire
summary: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew and the other a devout Christian, are driven to win in the 1924 Olympics as they wrestle with issues of pride and conscience.

title: On Golden Pond
summary: Norman is a curmudgeon with an estranged relationship with his daughter Chelsea. At Golden Pond, he and his wife nevertheless agree to care for Billy, the son of Chelsea's new boyfriend, and a most unexpected relationship blooms.

title: Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark
summary: Archaeology professor Indiana Jones ventures to seize a biblical artefact known as the Ark of the Covenant. While doing so, he puts up a fight against Renee and a troop of Nazis.

title: Raging Bull
summary: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

title: Ordinary People
summary: The accidental death of the older son of an affluent family deeply strains the relationships among the bitter mother, the good-natured father and the guilt-ridden younger son.

title: Coal Miner's Daughter
summary: The fictionalized life of singer Loretta Lynn, a girl who rose from humble beginnings to become a country music star in the 1960s/70s.

title: The Elephant Man
summary: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of kindness, intelligence and sophistication.

title: Tess
summary: A strong-willed young peasant girl attracts the affection of two men.

title: Breaking Away
summary: A working-class Indiana teen obsessed with the Italian cycling team vies for the affections of a college girl while searching for life goals with his friends.

title: Norma Rae
summary: A young single mother and textile worker agrees to help unionize her mill despite the problems and dangers involved.

title: All That Jazz
summary: Director/choreographer Bob Fosse tells his own life story as he details the sordid career of Joe Gideon, a womanizing, drug-using dancer.

title: Apocalypse Now
summary: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.
producer: Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Roos, Gray Frederickson, and Tom Sternberg

title: Kramer vs. Kramer
summary: After his wife leaves him, a work-obsessed Manhattan advertising executive is forced to learn long-neglected parenting skills, but a heated custody battle over the couple's young son deepens the wounds left by the separation.

title: An Unmarried Woman
summary: A wealthy woman from Manhattan's Upper East Side struggles to deal with her new identity and her sexuality after her husband of 16 years leaves her for a younger woman.

title: Coming Home
summary: A woman whose husband is fighting in Vietnam falls in love with another man who suffered a paralyzing combat injury there.

title: Midnight Express
summary: Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

title: The Deer Hunter
summary: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of several friends in a small steel mill town in Pennsylvania.
producer: Barry Spikings, Michael Deeley, Michael Cimino, and John Peverall

title: Heaven Can Wait
summary: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away from his body by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.

title: The Turning Point
summary: When her daughter joins a ballet company, a former dancer is forced to confront her long-ago decision to give up the stage to have a family.

title: Annie Hall
summary: Alvy Singer, a divorced Jewish comedian, reflects on his relationship with ex-lover Annie Hall, an aspiring nightclub singer, which ended abruptly just like his previous marriages.

title: The Goodbye Girl
summary: After being dumped by her live-in boyfriend, an unemployed dancer and her 10-year-old daughter are reluctantly forced to live with a struggling off-Broadway actor.

title: Star Wars
summary: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

title: Julia
summary: At the behest of an old and dear friend, playwright Lillian Hellman undertakes a dangerous mission to smuggle funds into Nazi Germany.

title: Taxi Driver
summary: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.

title: All the President's Men
summary: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon's resignation.

title: Rocky
summary: A small-time Philadelphia boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight the world heavyweight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.

title: Bound for Glory
summary: The early life of Woody Guthrie as a vagabond folk singer.
producer: Robert F. Blumofe and Harold Leventhal

title: Network
summary: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit, but finds that his message may be difficult to control.

title: Nashville
summary: Over the course of a few hectic days, numerous interrelated people prepare for a political convention.

title: Dog Day Afternoon
summary: Three amateur bank robbers plan to hold up a bank. A nice simple robbery: Walk in, take the money, and run. Unfortunately, the supposedly uncomplicated heist suddenly becomes a bizarre nightmare as everything that could go wrong does.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
summary: A criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.
film: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

title: Jaws
summary: When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community off Cape Cod, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.
producer: Richard D. Zanuck and David Brown

title: Barry Lyndon
summary: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

title: The Conversation
summary: A paranoid, secretive surveillance expert has a crisis of conscience when he suspects that the couple he is spying on will be murdered.

title: Lenny
summary: The story of acerbic 1960s comic Lenny Bruce, whose groundbreaking, no-holds-barred style and social commentary was often deemed by the Establishment as too obscene for the public.

title: Chinatown
summary: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer in 1930s Los Angeles finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

title: The Godfather Part II
summary: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.
producer: Francis Ford Coppola, Gray Frederickson, and Fred Roos

title: The Godfather Part III
summary: Follows Michael Corleone, now in his 60s, as he seeks to free his family from crime and find a suitable successor to his empire.

title: The Towering Inferno
summary: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out that threatens to destroy the tower and everyone in it.

title: Cries & Whispers
summary: When a woman dying of cancer in early twentieth-century Sweden is visited by her two sisters, long-repressed feelings between the siblings rise to the surface.

title: A Touch of Class
summary: Romantic comedy about a pair of clandestine lovers in a London-Spain tryst.

title: American Graffiti
summary: A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals.
producer: Francis Ford Coppola and Gary Kurtz

title: The Sting
summary: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.
producer: Tony Bill, Michael Phillips, and Julia Phillips

title: The Exorcist
summary: When a 12-year-old girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two priests to save her.

title: The Emigrants
summary: Småland, Sweden, mid-19th century. A farming family struggle with their rocky, unyielding land, and decide to embark on the arduous journey to new hope in America.

title: Sounder
summary: The oldest son of a loving and strong family of black sharecroppers comes of age in the Depression-era South after his father is imprisoned for stealing food.

title: Deliverance
summary: Intent on seeing the Cahulawassee River before it's dammed and turned into a lake, outdoor fanatic Lewis Medlock takes his friends on a canoeing trip they'll never forget into the dangerous American back-country.

title: Cabaret
summary: A female girlie club entertainer in Weimar Republic era Berlin romances two men while the Nazi Party rises to power around them.

title: The Godfather
summary: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty in postwar New York City transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant youngest son.

title: Nicholas and Alexandra
summary: Tsar Nicholas II, the inept last monarch of Russia, insensitive to the needs of his people, is overthrown and exiled to Siberia with his family.

title: A Clockwork Orange
summary: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

title: The French Connection
summary: A pair of NYPD detectives in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a heroin smuggling ring based in Marseilles, but stopping them and capturing their leaders proves an elusive goal.

title: The Last Picture Show
summary: In 1951, a group of high schoolers come of age in a bleak, isolated, atrophied North Texas town that is slowly dying, both culturally and economically.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
summary: In pre-revolutionary Russia, a Jewish peasant with traditional values contends with marrying off three of his daughters with modern romantic ideals while growing anti-Semitic sentiment threatens his village.

title: Five Easy Pieces
summary: A dropout from upper-class America picks up work along the way on oil rigs when his life isn't spent in a squalid succession of bars, motels, and other points of interest.

title: Patton
summary: The World War II phase of the career of controversial American general George S. Patton.

title: MASH
summary: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

title: Airport
summary: A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.

title: Love Story
summary: A boy and a girl from different backgrounds fall in love regardless of their upbringing - and then tragedy strikes.

title: Z
summary: The public murder of a prominent politician and doctor amid a violent demonstration is covered up by military and government officials. A tenacious magistrate is determined not to let them get away with it.

title: Anne of the Thousand Days
summary: King Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Catharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favor of the young and beautiful Anne Boleyn.

title: Hello, Dolly!
summary: Matchmaker Dolly Levi travels to Yonkers to find a partner for "half-a-millionaire" Horace Vandergelder, convincing his niece, his niece's intended, and his two clerks to travel to New York City along the way.

title: Midnight Cowboy
summary: A naive hustler travels from Texas to New York City to seek personal fortune, finding a new friend in the process.

title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
summary: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.
film: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid

title: Oliver!
summary: After being sold to a mortician, young orphan Oliver Twist runs away and meets a group of boys trained to be pickpockets by an elderly mentor in 1830s London.

title: The Lion in Winter
summary: 1183 A.D.: King Henry II's three sons all want to inherit the throne, but he won't commit to a choice. When he allows his imprisoned wife Eleanor of Aquitaine out for a Christmas visit, they all variously plot to force him into a decision.

title: Romeo and Juliet
summary: When two young members of feuding families meet, forbidden love ensues.

title: Funny Girl
summary: The life of Fanny Brice, famed comedienne and entertainer of the early 1900s. We see her rise to fame as a Ziegfeld girl, subsequent career, and her personal life, particularly her relationship with Nick Arnstein.

title: Rachel, Rachel
summary: Rachel is a lonely school teacher who lives with her mother. When a man from the big city asks her out, she starts thinking about where she wants her life to go.

title: Doctor Dolittle
summary: After the animal communicating veterinarian goes too far for his clientele, he and his friends escape their hometown to the sea in search of the Great Pink Sea Snail.

title: In the Heat of the Night
summary: A black Philadelphia police detective is mistakenly suspected of a local murder while passing through a racially hostile Mississippi town, and after being cleared is reluctantly asked by the police chief to investigate the case.
film: In the Heat of the Night

title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
summary: A couple's attitudes are challenged when their daughter introduces them to her African-American fiancé.

title: The Graduate
summary: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.

title: Bonnie and Clyde
summary: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

title: Alfie
summary: An unrepentant ladies' man gradually begins to understand the consequences of his lifestyle.

title: The Russians Are Coming the Russians Are Coming
summary: Without hostile intent, a Soviet submarine runs aground off New England. Men are sent for a boat, but many villagers go into a tizzy, risking bloodshed.
film: The Russians Are Coming, the Russians Are Coming

title: A Man for All Seasons
summary: The story of Sir Thomas More, who stood up to King Henry VIII when the King rejected the Roman Catholic Church to obtain a divorce and remarry.

title: The Sand Pebbles
summary: In 1926, a U.S. Naval engineer gets assigned to a gunboat on a rescue mission in war-torn China.

title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
summary: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use their young houseguests to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other over the course of a distressing night.

title: A Thousand Clowns
summary: A middle-aged iconoclast, doggedly avoiding the tedium of employment and conventional life, faces the prospect of losing custody of his young ward.

title: Doctor Zhivago
summary: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution.

title: The Sound of Music
summary: A young novitiate is sent by her convent in 1930s Austria to become a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval officer.

title: Darling
summary: Beautiful but amoral model Diana Scott sleeps her way to the top of the London fashion scene at the height of the Swinging Sixties.

title: Ship of Fools
summary: A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for pre-WWII Germany represents a microcosm of early 1930s society.

title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
summary: An insane American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.
film: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb

title: My Fair Lady
summary: In 1910s London, snobbish phonetics professor Henry Higgins agrees to a wager that he can make crude flower girl, Eliza Doolittle, presentable in high society.

title: Mary Poppins
summary: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

title: Becket
summary: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

title: Zorba the Greek
summary: An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

title: Tom Jones
summary: The romantic and chivalrous adventures of adopted bastard Tom Jones in 18th-century England.

title: How the West Was Won
summary: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

title: Cleopatra
summary: Queen Cleopatra VII of Egypt experiences both triumph and tragedy as she attempts to resist the imperial ambitions of Rome.

title: America America
summary: A young Greek stops at nothing to secure a passage to America.

title: Lilies of the Field
summary: A travelling handyman becomes the answer to the prayers of nuns who wish to build a chapel in the desert.

title: Mutiny on the Bounty
summary: In 1787, British ship Bounty leaves Portsmouth to bring a cargo of bread-fruit from Tahiti but the savage on-board conditions imposed by Captain Bligh trigger a mutiny led by officer Fletcher Christian.

title: The Music Man
summary: Traveling con artist Harold Hill targets the naïve residents of a small town in 1910s Iowa by posing as a boys' band leader to raise money before he can skip town.

title: The Longest Day
summary: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

title: Lawrence of Arabia
summary: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: Atticus Finch, a widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.
